PT J
AU Otsuka, T
   Fukunishi, N
AF Otsuka, T
   Fukunishi, N
TI Nuclear mean field on and near the drip lines
SO PHYSICS REPORTS-REVIEW SECTION OF PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Symposium on the Harmony of Physics, to Honor the 70th Birthday of a
   World-Renowned Russian Physicist Academician Spartak Belyaev
CY MAY 09-11, 1994
CL PHILADELPHIA, PA
SP Univ Penn, Drexel Univ
HO UNIV PENN, DAVID RITTENHOUSE LAB
ID NEUTRON-RICH NUCLEI; REACTION CROSS-SECTIONS; SHELL-MODEL; LIGHT-NUCLEI;
   BETA-DECAY; 2+ STATE; ISOTOPES; SODIUM; BE-11; HALO
AB We discuss two subjects related to the structure of nuclei near the drip lines. The first is the vanishing of N = 20 magic structure in Z much less than N = 20 nuclei. Large-scale state-of-the-art shell-model calculations with 2s1d and lower 2p1f shells are shown to present a unified description of N = 20 isotones with Z = 10-20, covering both stable and unstable nuclei. The calculations demonstrate that, although the N = 20 closed-shell structure remains for Z greater than or equal to 14, the N = 20 closed-shell structure vanishes naturally towards nuclei with Z less than or equal to 12, giving rise to various anomalous features including those in Mg-32 and Na-31. It is suggested that, in these nuclei, the deformed mean field overcomes the shell gap created by the spherical mean potential. Furthermore, the almost perfect agreement with a recent experiment is presented for the B(E2; 0(1)(+) --> 2(1)(+)) value of Mg-32. The second part is devoted to the mean field for loosely bound neutrons. The variational shell model (VSM) is explained with an application to the anomalous ground state of Be-11. The VSM has been proposed recently to describe the structure of neutron-rich unstable nuclei. Contrary to the failure of spherical Hartree-Fock, the anomalous 1/2(+) ground state and its neutron halo are reproduced with Skyrme SIII interaction. This state is bound due to dynamical coupling between the core and the loosely bound neutron which oscillates between 2s(1/2) and 1d(5/2) orbits. The direct neutron capture is discussed briefly in its relation to the neutron halo.
C1 RIKEN,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.
RP Otsuka, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,HONGO 7-3-1,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI Microscopic basis of the Interacting Boson Model
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS SUPPLEMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID COLLECTIVE NUCLEAR-STATES; DEFORMED-NUCLEI; SHELL-MODEL; SYSTEMS; PAIRS;
   MONOPOLE; MAPPINGS; NILSSON; LIMIT
AB The microscopic basis of the IBM is discussed in this paper, presenting a derivation of the IBM system from the multi-nucleon system. Although there could be different approaches to this goal as stated in the preface of this supplement, we focus on two approaches. One is the Otsuka-Arima-Iachello mapping, which works for the spherical and near-spherical nuclei. The other is a mapping for deformed nuclei.

TI Microscopic calculations for O(6) nuclei by the Interacting Boson Model
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS SUPPLEMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID SHELL-MODEL; STATES; PROTON; LIMIT
AB We present microscopic calculations of the Interacting Boson Model (IBM) based on the shell model interaction by using the OAI mapping approach. We determine the collective pairs, which correspond to the IBM bosons, by the number conserved Hartree-Fock-Bogoluibov (HFB) and the proton-neutron Tamm-Dancoff methods, and we take into consideration couplings to the non-collective degrees of freedom. The present realistic calculations are carried out for the Te, Xe and Ba isotopes. Among them, the Xe isotopes are known by numerous phenomenological works to show the O(6) symmetry. We present the clear O(6) symmetry in the spectra and the wave function which are microscopically obtained.
C1 RIKEN,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.

TI Halo structure of Li-11 and Gamow-Teller transitions to Be-11
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS SUPPLEMENT
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Proceedings of the International Workshop on Structure and Dynamics of
   Quantum Many-Body Systems
CY AUG 19-22, 1995
CL AIZU, JAPAN
SP Univ Aizu,, Kyoto Univ, Yukawa Inst Theoret Phys
HO UNIV OF AIZU
ID NEUTRON-RICH NUCLEI; BETA-DECAY; CROSS-SECTIONS; ENERGY-LEVELS;
   LIGHT-NUCLEI; SHELL-MODEL; DEPENDENCE
AB Effects of the halo as well as meson exchange currents (MEC) are studied for the GT beta transition Li-11 (3/2(-)) --> Be-11 (1/2(-), 0.32 MeV). They are found to be important to reduce transition matrix elements and remedy deviations from the observed log ft value of the GT transition. This GT transition is shown to play an indispensable role in identifying the structure of two-neutron halo of Li-11. It is indicated that the two neutrons forming the halo consist of the p(1/2)(2) configuration with 60 similar to 70 % probability. Distribution of the GT transitions is discussed and compared with the GT sum rule.

TI Superdeformation in the Hg-Pb region and an extension of IBM
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS SUPPLEMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTING BOSON-MODEL; HIGH-SPIN STATES; ROTATING NUCLEI; SHAPE
   ISOMERISM; 1/N EXPANSION; 190 REGION; DEFORMED-NUCLEI; SHELL-MODEL;
   BANDS; HG-192
AB The superdeformation in the Hg-Pb region is investigated on the basis of the Nilsson + particle-number-conserving BCS model and the Interacting Boson Model. The basic structure of the superdeformed states is studied especially from the viewpoint of the collective nucleon pairs. Significant differences are found in the structure of collective pairs between the cases of the normal and the superdeformed states. The Interacting Boson Model is extended to describe the superdeformation. A phenomenological Hamiltonian is presented and applied to clarify the stabilization mechanisms and the spin dependent properties of the superdeformed states. It is shown that the unified description of two different configurations, normal low-lying states and the superdeformed states can be made within this framework. Systematic description of dynamic moment of inertia is given by considering the effects of quadrupole parameters.

AF SUZUKI, T

   MUTA, A
TI MAGNETIC-MOMENT OF BE-11
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
DE NEUTRON HALO
ID NUCLEI
AB Magnetic moments of a neutron-halo nucleus, Be-11, are investigated. The neutron halo is found to reduce the meson exchange current (MEC) contributions to the magnetic moment of Be-11 (1/2(g.s.)(+)). The calculated magnetic moment is found to be sensitive to the admixture of \Be-10(2(+)) x d(5/2) : 1/2(+)) configuration in Be-11(g.s.). The measurement of the magnetic moment is highly recommended for the determination of the rate of the admixture of \Be-10(2(+)) x d(5/2) : 1/2(+)) configuration Be-11(g.s.).

AF YOSHIOKA, S
   ASO, Y
   OTSUKA, T
   KOJIMA, S
TI WATER MOBILITY IN POLY(ETHYLENE GLYCOL)-, POLY(VINYLPYRROLIDONE)-, AND
   GELATIN-WATER SYSTEMS, AS INDICATED BY DIELECTRIC-RELAXATION TIME,
   SPIN-LATTICE RELAXATION-TIME, AND WATER ACTIVITY
SO JOURNAL OF PHARMACEUTICAL SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
ID NUCLEAR-MAGNETIC-RESONANCE; AQUEOUS-SOLUTIONS; HYDRATION; O-17;
   SPECTROSCOPY; HYDROLYSIS; STABILITY; MIXTURES; DRUG; GELS
AB The mobility of water molecules present in poly(ethylene glycol) (PEG)-, poly(vinylpyrrolidone) (PVP)-, and gelatin-water systems was determined by dielectric relaxation and O-17 NMR spectroscopy. Water activity was also measured. Dielectric relaxation spectra indicate that all the polymer systems studied contained water exhibiting a dispersion at a frequency >10(9) Hz; in other words, water with high mobility close to that of bulk water. The dielectric relaxation time of the highly mobile water increased as polymer concentration increased. The PVP- and gelatin-water systems also contained water exhibiting a dispersion at a frequency <10(9) Hz, which can be considered to be ''bound water'' with a restricted mobility because of its association with polymer molecules. Dielectric relaxation spectroscopy was used to determine water mobility separately for the populations of highly mobile water and bound water, whereas NMR relaxation spectroscopy was used to determine the average mobility of both populations. The spin-lattice relaxation time of water in these polymer-water systems showed a deviation from the isotropic two-state model. Dielectric relaxation data indicate that this deviation can be ascribed to variations in the relaxation time of highly mobile water caused by a change in polymer concentration. The dielectric relaxation time of highly mobile water in the gelatin system did not change with a change in polymer concentration to the extent that it did in the PEG and PVP systems. This result is consistent with a slight change in water activity of the gelatin system with increasing polymer concentration. Although water activity was useful as a measure of the mobility of highly mobile water, information on the dynamics of bound water cannot be obtained from water activity.
RP YOSHIOKA, S (reprint author), NATL INST HLTH SCI,1-18-1 KAMIYOGA,TOKYO 158,JAPAN.

TI DIAGONALIZATION OF HAMILTONIANS FOR MANY-BODY SYSTEMS BY AUXILIARY FIELD
   QUANTUM MONTE-CARLO TECHNIQUE
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID BOSON
AB We propose a Monte Carlo method for solving the quantum many-body interacting systems. Mean fields dominating the structure of low-lying states are selected by a Monte Carlo method, which generates optimum many-body basis states for diagonalizing the Hamiltonian consisting of one- and two-body terms. Not only the ground state but also low-lying excited states are obtained with their wave functions. Results are examined by comparison to exact values.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
   INST PHYS & CHEM RES,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.
RP HONMA, M (reprint author), UNIV AIZU,CTR MATH SCI,IKKI MACHI,AIZU WAKAMATSU,FUKUSHIMA 965,JAPAN.

TI FISCHER INDOLIZATION OF ETHYL PYRUVATE 2-BIS(2-METHOXYPHENYL)HYDRAZONE
   AND NEW INSIGHT INTO THE MECHANISM OF FISCHER INDOLIZATION - (FISCHER
   INDOLIZATION AND ITS RELATED-COMPOUNDS .27.)
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE FISCHER INDOLIZATION; DIARYLHYDRAZONE; INDOLE; REACTION MECHANISM;
   CHLORODIPHENYLAMINE; GOLDBERG REACTION
ID CYCLIZATION
AB In connection with studies on the direction of cyclization in the Fischer indolization of substituted diphenylhydrazones, the Fischer indolization of ethyl pyruvate 2-bis(2-methoxyphenyl)hydrazone (6) was carried out. The result showed that cyclization in Fischer indolization of diphenylhydrazone does not always proceed to the electron-richer nucleus, but depends on the conformation of the enehydrazine. Thus, the Fischer indolization should proceed via a [3,3] sigmatropic route, with an electronic effect.
RP MURAKAMI, Y (reprint author), TOHO UNIV,SCH PHARMACEUT SCI,2-2-1 MIYAMA,FUNABASHI,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.

TI THE EFFECT OF GAMMA-IRRADIATION ON DRUG-RELEASE FROM POLY(LACTIDE)
   MICROSPHERES
SO RADIATION PHYSICS AND CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
ID POLY(L-LACTIDE) MICROSPHERES; MORPHOLOGY
AB The physicochemical properties of gamma-irradiated poly(lactide) microspheres was studied to elucidate the effect of gamma-irradiation (5-100 kGy) on their release characteristics. gamma-Irradiation of microspheres reduced the average molecular weight of the polymer and increased the carboxylic acid content as a function of the dose. This suggests that gamma-irradiation caused polymer decomposition including hydrolysis. The polymer degradation caused by irradiation at a dose up to 25 kGy brought about no significant changes in the glass transition temperature (T-g) and initial drug release rate. Irradiation at 100 kGy, however, significantly increased the initial release rate and also brought about an abrupt increase in release rate in the course of drug release. The abrupt increase in release rate occured when the T-g was lowered below the 37 degrees C point at which release studies were carried out. This indicates that the polymer decomposition caused by irradiation may accelerate polymer decomposition in the release media and shorten the time required for the T-g to become lower than 37 degrees C. The results suggest that the release rate will not be significantly affected by irradiation at a dose up to 25 kGy if the microspheres are designed to complete drug release before the T-g reaches 37 degrees C.
RP YOSHIOKA, S (reprint author), NATL INST HLTH SCI,TOKYO 158,JAPAN.
CR ASO Y, 1993, INT J PHARM, V93, P153, DOI 10.1016/0378-5173(93)90173-D

TI GRANULOCYTE-COLONY-STIMULATING FACTOR MOBILIZES PRIMITIVE HEMATOPOIETIC
   STEM-CELLS IN NORMAL INDIVIDUALS
SO BONE MARROW TRANSPLANTATION
LA English
DT Article
DE GRANULOCYTE COLONY-STIMULATING FACTOR (G-CSF); NORMAL INDIVIDUALS;
   LONG-TERM CULTURE INITIATING CELLS (LTC-IC)
ID PERIPHERAL-BLOOD; PROGENITOR CELLS; ALLOGENEIC TRANSPLANTATION; G-CSF;
   MARROW; INVITRO; PROLIFERATION; CHEMOTHERAPY
AB We studied the hematopoietic activity of peripheral blood stem cells (PBSC) mobilized by recombinant human granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF) using semisolid and long-term culture systems (LTC) in 5 normal individuals, Following 2 or 3 daily subcutaneous injections of G-CSF (filgrastim; 1.5 mu g/kg), not only committed progenitors including CFU-GM, BFU-E, and CFU-Mix, but also long-term culture initiating cells (LTC-IC) were increased in the peripheral blood, When the cells derived from CFU-GM, BFU-E and CFU-Mix colonies were replated for secondary colony formation, a minor fraction of CFU-GM and CFU-Mix colonies formed after 3 days of G-CSF stimulation irt vivo could produce secondary colonies, Moreover, the replating capacity of primary colonies from 5-week-old LTC initiated after 3 days of G-CSF stimulation was increased compared to that from 5-week-old LTC initiated in a 'steady-state', These observations indicate that G-CSF can mobilize very primitive progenitors (LTC-IC) along with committed progenitors into the circulation and suggest that some of these G-CSF-mobilized progenitors may retain self-renewal capacity.
C1 KYUSHU UNIV,CTR CANC,HIGASHI KU,FUKUOKA 812,JAPAN.

TI WATER MOBILITY IN AQUEOUS-SOLUTIONS OF MACROMOLECULAR PHARMACEUTICAL
   EXCIPIENTS MEASURED BY O-17 NUCLEAR-MAGNETIC-RESONANCE
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE SPIN-LATTICE RELAXATION TIME; WATER MOBILITY; POLYETHYLENEGLYCOL;
   POLY(VINYLPYRROLIDONE); GELATIN
ID BETA-GALACTOSIDASE; STABILITY; HYDROLYSIS; DRUG; GELS
AB The dynamics of water molecules associated with water-soluble polymers were studied by O-17-NMR. The observed spin-lattice relaxation time, T-1(obs), of water in aqueous solutions of polyethylene glycol (PEG), poly(vinylpyrrolidone) (PVP) and gelatin at polymer concentrations below 0.12 g/g of water could be described by an isotropic two-state model with a fast exchange. The tendency for the polymers to reduce the T-1(obs) of water was on the order of PEG < gelatin < PVP. At higher concentrations, deviations from the model were observed for PVP and gelatin. The T-1(obs) of water in the PEG solution was not affected by the molecular weight of the polymer. This suggests that the microviscosity around the polymer molecules is governed by the interaction between the polymer unit and water molecules, and is not affected by the molecular weight of polymers in contrast to the ''macroviscosity''. The polymer-water interaction that reduced the T-1(obs) of water was found to decrease with increasing temperature for all the polymers studied. The T-1(obs) of water in the gelatin solution exhibited the largest temperature dependence, suggesting that changes might occur in the molecular structure of gelatin at higher temperatures.
C1 NATL INST HLTH SCI,TOKYO 158,JAPAN.

TI TRANSFER AND FUSION REACTIONS OF UNSTABLE NUCLEI
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Physics of Unstable Nuclei
CY OCT 31-NOV 03, 1994
CL NIIGATA, JAPAN
SP NIIGATA UNIV, FAC SCI, UNIV TOKYO, INST NUCL STUDY, INST PHYS & CHEM RES
ID HARTREE-FOCK CALCULATIONS
AB The transfer and fusion reactions are studied for reactions between a stable and an unstable nucleus with neutron skin, taking as examples the reactions O-16,O-28+Ca-40. The two-dimensional time-dependent Hartree-Fock method is used. It is shown that, in such reactions, the nucleon transfer is enhanced enormously for both protons and neutrons. The neutron skin does not enhance the fusion cross section contrary to the usual expectation.

TI STRUCTURE OF NUCLEI FAR FROM STABILITY

ID CROSS-SECTIONS; NEUTRON; LI-11
AB The structure of neutron-rich unstable nuclei is discussed by focusing on three different subjects; (i) a superdeformed halo nucleus Be-11 studied by a deformed Woods-Saxon potential, (ii) retarded beta decay due to neutron halo in Li-11, and (iii) giant neutron excitations in nuclei with neutron skin.

TI A RELATION BETWEEN E2 MATRIX-ELEMENTS CONNECTING COLLECTIVE STATES OF
   DEFORMED-NUCLEI
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTING BOSON APPROXIMATION
AB A relation is presented stating that a sum of certain products of E2 matrix elements connecting the 0(+) and 2(+) levels in the ground, beta-, and gamma-bands in the limit of strong quadrupole deformation vanishes, As a consequence beta --> g E2 matrix elements are much smaller than beta --> gamma matrix elements, contrary to the naive expectation based on the vibrational picture of independent beta and gamma excitations. This relation is supported by experimental data on deformed nuclei, and suggests a re-examination of the traditional understanding of these basic collective modes and their inter-relationships.
C1 BROOKHAVEN NATL LAB,DEPT PHYS,UPTON,NY 11973.
   CLARK UNIV,DEPT CHEM,WORCESTER,MA 01610.

   OTSUKA, T
TI LOW-SPIN STATES IN BA-130
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
DE SN-120(N-14,4N), E=65 MEV MEASURED GAMMA-GAMMA-COIN; FOLLOWING RESIDUE
   BETA(+) DECAY; LA-130(BETA(+)) [FROM SN-120(N-14,4N), E=65 MEV],
   MEASURED GAMMA-GAMMA(THETA); BA-130 DEDUCED LEVELS, TAU, PI, DELTA;
   INTERACTING BOSON MODEL COMPARISON
ID INTERACTING BOSON MODEL; COLLECTIVE NUCLEAR-STATES; LOW-LYING LEVELS; M1
   TRANSITIONS; LIMIT; DEFORMATION; SYMMETRY; O(6)
AB The low spin structure of Ba-130 has been investigated following the beta(+)-decay of ground and medium spin isomeric states of La-130. The lanthanum nuclei were produced at the Cologne FN-tandem accelerator using the reaction Sn-120(N-14,4n)La-130. gamma gamma-coincidence data was taken by means of the OSIRIS 6-cube spectrometer. Many new low lying levels were established. Of special interest are new ''K = 0''- and ''K = 4''-bands. We give the level and transition energies, spins and parities, multipole mixing ratios and B(E2)-ratios obtained from this measurement. The low lying stares of positive parity are discussed in the framework of the IBA-1 model and compared with results for the F-spin partner Xe-126. The description is given in terms of a consistent-Q formalism near the dynamical O(6)-symmetry. A new scheme which gives analytical expressions for the O(6)-wave functions is presented. The scheme is still valid approximately in vicinity of O(6).
C1 UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI COEXISTENCE OF INTERMOLECULAR FERROMAGNETIC INTERACTION AND [NHN](+)
   HYDROGEN-BOND IN N-PROTONATED M-PYRIDYL NITRONYL NITROXIDE
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-CHEMICAL COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURES
AB Reaction of 2-(3-pyridyl)-4,4,5,5-tetramethyl-4,5-dihydro-1H-imidazol-1-oxyl 3-N-oxide (m-PYNN) and HBr gas gives rise to the complex (m-PYNN)(2)HBr, in which the coexistence of an intermolecular ferromagnetic interaction and an [NHN]+ hydrogen bond is found.

TI ODD-SPIN YRAST STATES AS MULTIPLE QUADRUPOLE-PHONON EXCITATIONS
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTING BOSON APPROXIMATION; DEFORMED-NUCLEI; CD-114; BANDS
AB The wavefunctions of the lowest odd spin positive parity yrast states in the IBA are shown to be nearly pure multiple quadrupole-phonon excitations even outside the three dynamical symmetries. The empirical data for collective nuclei with 30 less than or equal to Z less than or equal to 80 confirm these predictions. The quadrupole-phonon purity of the 2(1)(+) state can be measured from E2-branching ratios of the 3(1)(+) state. These data show a high correlation to the 2(1)(+) Q-phonon purity deduced from the E2-decay of 2(+) states.

TI THE PHYSICAL STABILITY OF AMORPHOUS NIFEDIPINE DETERMINED BY ISOTHERMAL
   MICROCALORIMETRY
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE STABILITY; MICROCALORIMETRY; CRYSTALLIZATION; NIFEDIPINE; GLASS
   TRANSITION TEMPERATURE (T-G)
ID HEAT-CONDUCTION MICROCALORIMETRY; PHARMACEUTICAL STABILITY; ANHYDROUS
   LACTOSE; AQUEOUS-SOLUTION; SOLID-STATE; CALORIMETRY
AB The applicability of isothermal microcalorimetry to evaluation of the physical stability of amorphous nifedipine was examined, Amorphous nifedipine was obtained by fusion and subsequent rapid cooling, and its crystallization heat at a constant temperature was measured using a heat-conductive microcalorimeter, The heat production due to crystallization of amorphous nifedipine and the transformation of its metastable crystalline form into a stable crystalline one was detected at a temperature above its glass transition temperature (T-g), The time required for half an amorphous nifedipine sample to be crystallized (t(50)) was calculated from the heat production time profile, and the reciprocal of t(50) (1/t(50)) was used as a measure of the crystallization rate, which increased as the temperature increased, The Williams, Landel and Ferry (WLF) plot of 1/t(50) was linear, indicating that the crystallization rate was affected by the nifedipine matrix viscosity, which decreased as the temperature increased, Moisture decreased the T-g of the fused nifedipine and increased its crystallization rate, The effects of temperature and humidity can be interpreted by changes in the matrix viscosity, which is related to the molecular motion of nifedipine,

TI NONYRAST STATES IN XE-125
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
DE TE-122((ALPHA, N), E = 16 MEV, TE-123(ALPHA, 2N), E = 26 MEV, MEASURED
   GAMMA-GAMMA-COIN, GAMMA(THETA), GAMMA LINEAR POLARIZATION; XE-125
   DEDUCED LEVELS, J, PI, BRANCHING RATIO
ID NEGATIVE-PARITY STATES; ODD-MASS NUCLEI; MULTILEVEL CALCULATIONS;
   TRIAXIAL DEFORMATION; EXCITED-STATES; EVEN NUCLEI; BA; XE; REGION; CE
AB The non-yrast states of Xe-125 have been investigated with the Te-122(alpha, n) and Te-123(alpha, 2n) reactions by means of in-beam gamma-spectroscopy using a setup of 6 Compton-suppressed high-purity-germanium (HPGe)detectors. Over 400 new transitions establishing over 110 new levels could be placed in a level scheme totalling 196 levels connected by 563 transitions. 77 spin and parity assignments were made (some of them tentatively) and 35 multipolarity mixing ratios could be assigned to transitions using the gamma-angular distribution, gamma-linear polarization, gamma gamma-DCO-analysis and gamma-excitation-function methods. The negative-parity data are compared to the predictions of the rigid-triaxial-rotor-plus-particle model and the interacting-boson-fermion model. Both calculations describe successfully the excitation energies of these non-yrast states. The branching ratios of the lower non-yrast states are also reproduced very well. Only at the fourth and higher excited states of a given spin, a discrepancy between experiment and theory was observed.

TI F-SPIN MULTIPLETS AND M1 TRANSITIONS
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Spin-Isospin Responses and Weak Processes in
   Hadrons and Nuclei
CY MAR 08-10, 1994
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP MINIST EDUC SCI & CULTURE JAPAN
HO SENRI LIFE SCI CTR
ID INTERACTING BOSONS; SHELL-MODEL; NUCLEAR; PROTON; BANDS
AB F-spin multiplets in the A=100 region have been investigated. While the energy constancy inside these multiplets is bad in comparison with deformed rare earth nuclei,the M1 transition strengths are relatively large. This shows that the energy variation in the multiplet is at least partly due to F-spin mixing. IBM-2 calculations of excitation energies,E2 and M1 strengths in (102)pd have been carried out.
C1 UNIV COLOGNE,INST KERNPHYS,D-50937 COLOGNE,GERMANY.

TI M1 EXCITATION OF DEFORMED-NUCLEI AND PROTON-NEUTRON CORRELATION
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Spin-Isospin Responses and Weak Processes in
   Hadrons and Nuclei
CY MAR 08-10, 1994
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP MINIST EDUC SCI & CULTURE JAPAN
HO SENRI LIFE SCI CTR
AB The proton-neutron correlation in the axially-symmetric rotor is studied. It is shown that, in and near the ground state, the proton and neutron deformed ellipsoids are rotating in the opposite directions, whereas they rotate about almost the same axis in states of higher spins. This holds, quite similarly, for angular-momentum-projected Nilsson wave functions and for wave functions in the Interacting Boson Model. The M1 excitation from the ground state is shown to reflect this correlation between the proton and neutron ellipsoids.

TI LITHIUM TRIS(OXALATO-O,O')CHROMATE(III) HEXAHYDRATE
SO ACTA CRYSTALLOGRAPHICA SECTION C-CRYSTAL STRUCTURE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL
AB In the title compound, 3Li[Cr(C2O4)3].6H2O, the Li cations are coordinated by 0 atoms of both the oxalato ligands and the solvent water molecules. Two of the six water molecules are not bonded to the Li cations but are instead hydrogen bonded to other water molecules or oxalato ligand molecules. The tris(oxalato)chromate(III) anion takes the form of a distorted octahedron. The average Cr-O distance and O-Cr-O angle of the chelate rings are 1.979 angstrom and 82.3-degrees, respectively.

TI G-CSF INDUCES TYROSINE PHOSPHORYLATION OF THE JAK2 PROTEIN IN THE HUMAN
   MYELOID G-CSF RESPONSIVE AND PROLIFERATIVE CELLS, BUT NOT IN MATURE
   NEUTROPHILS
SO BIOCHEMICAL AND BIOPHYSICAL RESEARCH COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID COLONY-STIMULATING FACTOR; TUMOR-NECROSIS-FACTOR; FACTOR-RECEPTOR;
   ERYTHROPOIETIN RECEPTOR; SIGNAL-TRANSDUCTION; CYTOPLASMIC DOMAIN;
   GRANULOCYTE; KINASE; INDUCTION; REGIONS
AB Granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF) stimulates a rapid phosphorylation on tyrosines of several proteins of Mr. 130, 100, 90, 70, 44 kd in human myeloid leukemia cell line cells, Kasumi-1, which respond to G-CSF to proliferate in vitro. In HL60 cells, only a 100 kd protein was phosphorylated, and no detectable phosphorylated proteins were observed in neutrophils by the stimulation of G-CSF. Among these proteins, the 130 kd protein was immunoprecipitated by anti- JAK2 serum. While JAK2 is a non receptor tyrosine kinase and is reported to be involved in the signal transduction by various cytokines including growth hormone, erythropoietin, and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor/interleukin-3, it is strongly suggested that a signaling pathway that relates to the cell proliferation triggered by G-CSF in immature hematopoietic cells also involves JAK2. (C) 1994 Academic Press, Inc.

TI MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION OF NUCLEI IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PF-SHELL BY A
   SHELL-MODEL CALCULATION WITH G-MATRIX INTERACTION
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
ID INELASTIC ELECTRON-SCATTERING; STATES; FE-56; SPECTROSCOPY; POTENTIALS
AB Energy levels and electromagnetic properties of 24 nuclides with N = 28-30 are studied in terms of a large-scale shell-model calculation, which contains no newly adjusted parameters. The Kuo-Brown G-matrix interaction is shown to reproduce energy levels of 205 low-lying states of all these nuclei. We evaluate effective charges by incorporating the core-polarization effects caused by the coupling to GQR's. We then compute E2 moments and transition probabilities. The M1 moments and transition rates are calculated by quoting the effective g-factors of Towner, which are obtained by taking into account the meson-exchange and the core-polarization mechanisms. By this microscopic calculation most of the E2 properties and the magnetic moments are reproduced. Although there are agreements and disagreements in the MI transition rates, the general tendency is reproduced. The (e,e') and (p,p') excitation from the ground state to some low-lying 2+ states is also discussed.
C1 HOSEI UNIV,COLL ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,TOKYO 184,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI NUCLEAR ROTATION AT LOW-SPIN
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Nuclear Structure Physics Today
CY MAY 11-15, 1993
CL CHUNGLI, TAIWAN
SP CHUNG YUAN CHRISTIAN UNIV
HO CHUNG YUAN CHRISTIAN UNIV
ID INTERACTING BOSONS; SHELL-MODEL; STATES
AB Two subjeCtS related to nuclear rotation at low angular momentum are discussed. One is the gamma-soft ''rotation'' in a microscopic calculation of the IBM-2, where it will be shown that we can reproduce gamma-soft collective levels in a microscopic IBM-2 using a standard effective nucleon-nucleon Hamiltonian. The other is about the rotation of the axially-symmetric rotor. It is shown that, in and near the ground state, the proton and neutron deformed ellipsoids are rotating in the opposite directions, whereas they rotate about almost the same axis in states of higher spins. This holds, quite similarly, for angular-momentum-projected Nilsson wave functions and for wave functions in the Interacting Boson Model.

TI SIGNATURE INVERSION IN ODD-ODD NUCLEI IN THE INTERACTING BOSON-FERMION
   MODEL
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Nuclear Structure Physics Today
CY MAY 11-15, 1993
CL CHUNGLI, TAIWAN
SP CHUNG YUAN CHRISTIAN UNIV
HO CHUNG YUAN CHRISTIAN UNIV
ID HIGH-SPIN STATES; ELECTROMAGNETIC PROPERTIES; SYMMETRY SCHEMES; A
   NUCLEI; AU-198; BANDS; SHAPE; LIMIT
AB The signature inversion in odd-odd nuclei is studied in the interacting boson-fermion model (IBFM). Energy levels and electromagnetic matrix elements are calculated with the SU(3) and the O(6) IBM2 cores. When the particles occupy high-j orbits, the signature inversion occurs with the O(6) core by strong exchange interactions between fermions and the O(6) core. The essential mechanism of the inversion is the mixing of the members of the quasi-gamma band into the unfavored states due to the exchange interactions.

TI STUDIES ON THE ANTIVIRAL ACTIVITY OF PROPAGERMANIUM WITH
   IMMUNOSTIMULATING ACTION
SO ARZNEIMITTEL-FORSCHUNG/DRUG RESEARCH
LA English
DT Article
DE ANTIVIRAL DRUGS; IMMUNOSTIMULANTS; PROPAGERMANIUM, PHARMACOLOGY; SK-818
AB The effects of propagermanium (3-oxygermylpropionic acid polymer) on various virus-infected mice were investigated. Propagermanium did not inhibit the multiplication of various DNA or RNA viruses in vitro. Oral administration of propagermanium in mice infected with herpes simplex virus type I (HSV-1) significantly prolonged the mean survival days. The efficacy of propagermanium at doses of 1 and 10 mg/kg daily was 13.4 +/- 2.3 and 14.2 +/- 2.3 mean survival days in comparison with 7.7 +/- 0.5 mean survival days at control group. In vaccinia virus-infected mice, oral doses of propagermanium ranging from 0.2 to 10 mg/kg suppressed the number of pocks on the tail which induced by the virus. Propagermanium (0.5-10 mg/kg) orally given to HSV-1-infected mice induced cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTL) against HSV-1 antigen. In addition, propagermanium (1-10 mg/kg) enhanced interferon-gamma (IFN-gamma) induction in mice treated with Mycobacterium bovis (BCG). In mice spleen cells cultured with Concanavalin A, 0.1 to 10 mug/ml of propagermanium stimulated interleukin 2 (IL-2) production. It seems likely that the antiviral activity of propagermanium was exerted via enhancement of host immune resistance against viral infection.
C1 SANWA KAGAKU KENKYUSHO CO LTD,MIE LAB,MIE,JAPAN.

AF NAKADA, H
   OTSUKA, T
TI E2 PROPERTIES OF NUCLEI FAR FROM STABILITY AND THE PROTON-HALO PROBLEM
   OF B-8
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW C
LA English
DT Article
ID P-SHELL NUCLEI; (0+2)H-OMEGA MODEL SPACE; ENERGY-LEVELS; LIGHT-NUCLEI;
   A=4-16 NUCLEI; EXCITATION; STATES; BEAMS
AB E2 properties of A = 6-10 nuclei, including those of nuclei far from stability, are studied by a (0+ 2)homegaBAR shell-model calculation which includes E2 core-polarization effects explicitly. The quadrupole moments and the E2 transition strengths in A = 6-10 nuclei are described quite well by the present calculation. This result indicates that the relatively large value of the quadrupole moment of B-8 can be understood without introducing the proton halo in B-8. An interesting effect of the 2HomegaBAR core-polarization is found for effective charges used in the 0HomegaBAR shell model; although isoscalar effective charges are almost constant as a function of nucleus, appreciable variations are needed for isovector effective charges which play important roles in nuclei with high isospin values.

PT J
AU YOSHIDA, N
   SAGAWA, H

AF YOSHIDA, N
   SAGAWA, H
   OTSUKA, T
TI SIGNATURE INVERSION IN ODD-ODD NUCLEI IN THE INTERACTING BOSON-FERMION
   MODEL
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
ID HIGH-SPIN STATES; ELECTROMAGNETIC PROPERTIES; A NUCLEI; SYMMETRY;
   AU-198; BANDS; SHAPE; LIMIT
AB The signature inversion in odd-odd nuclei is studied in terms of the interacting boson-fermion model (IBFM). Energy levels and electromagnetic matrix elements are calculated in the model in which a proton and a neutron are coupled to the SU(3) (deformed) and the O(6) (gamma-unstable) IBM2 cores. When the particles occupy high-j orbits, the signature inversion is caused in the O(6) limit by strong exchange interactions between fermions and the O(6) core. The essential mechanism of the inversion is the mixing of the members of the quasi-gamma band into the unfavored states due to the exchange interactions. In the case of the SU(3) core, the inversion never occurs when the particles are in high-j orbits. It is seen only around the band head when the fermion orbits have small angular momenta.

   GELBERG, A
   OTSUKA, T
TI E2 SELECTION-RULES OF GAMMA-RIGID AND GAMMA-UNSTABLE ROTORS
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL; ODD-A NUCLEI; O(6) LIMIT; SHAPE; APPROXIMATION;
   DEFORMATIONS; STATES
AB It has been known that the E2 selection rules are similar between the Davydov-Filippov rigid triaxial rotor model with gamma = 30 degrees and the O(6) limit of the interacting boson model (IBM). Using the O(6) limit of IBM, we investigate the relationship of the wavefunctions of O(6) and those of the Davydov-Filippov model. We introduce an intrinsic state with a fixed gamma-value and construct its intrinsic excitation. It was shown by Ginocchio and Kirson that the O(6) wavefunctions can be expressed using the intrinsic state by the integration with respect to the gamma-value. A formula is given which expresses the O(6) wavefunctions as a superposition of the gamma-fixed intrinsic state and its intrinsic excitation. A discrete symmetry of these intrinsic excitations has been found, and by using this symmetry, we analyze the close connection between the E2 selection rules of the Davydov-Filippov rotor model and the O(6) limit of IBM.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RP SUGITA, M (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,TOKAI,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.

TI MULTIPLE QUADRUPOLE PHONON EXCITATIONS IN BA-130
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID BOSON
AB The low spin structure of Ba-130 was investigated via the emitted gamma-radiation following the beta-decay of La-130. New ''K = 0''- and ''K = 4''-bands were identified. A comparison with the 0(6) symmetry of the IBM is shown. A discussion of the low lying levels of the 0(6) symmetry in terms of multiple quadrupole ''phonon'' excitations built on the ground state is given.

TI APPLICATION OF MICROCALORIMETRY TO STABILITY TESTING OF MECLOFENOXATE
   HYDROCHLORIDE AND DL-ALPHA-TOCOPHEROL
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE MICROCALORIMETRY; STABILITY; MECLOFENOXATE HYDROCHLORIDE;
   DL-ALPHA-TOCOPHEROL
ID HEAT-CONDUCTION MICROCALORIMETRY; SOLID-STATE STABILITY; PHARMACEUTICAL
   STABILITY; ISOTHERMAL CALORIMETRY; AQUEOUS-SOLUTION
AB Utility of the microcalorimetric technique as a method of predicting drug stability was investigated. The hydrolysis of meclofenoxate hydrochloride and the oxidation of dl-alpha-tocopherol were chosen as model reactions. The hydrolysis rate was calculated from the time profile of the heat production. The rate was also calculated from the time profile of the degradation obtained by HPLC. The agreement in the rates confirms the applicability of microcalorimetry in determining rates of chemical reactions, The oxidation of dl-alpha-tocopherol was slow and a constant heat production rate was observed. The oxidation rate was calculated from the constant heat production rate and the enthalpy change for the reaction, To determine the rate constant required only a day by microcalorimetric method, whereas from the time profile of the degradation obtained by HPLC it would require almost one year. The saving in time to determine the degradation rate of dl-alpha-tocopherol demonstrates the value of this method.
C1 NATL INST HYG SCI,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 158,JAPAN.

TI NEUTRON-SKIN AND PROTON-SKIN FORMATIONS IN EXOTIC NUCLEI FAR FROM
   STABILITY
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW C
LA English
DT Article
ID RICH NUCLEI; EXCITATION; FUSION
AB The neutron skin is studied in terms of the Hartree-Fock calculation, and its new definition is presented and discussed. It turns oui that the neutron skin is closely related to how far the nucleus is away from the beta stability line, but not directly to the number of excess neutrons. Related properties of Hartree-Fock calculations for unstable nuclei are discussed. Novel features associated with the neutron skin are suggested, for instance, neutron avalanche in reactions involving a nucleus with the neutron skin. The formation of the proton skin is shown to be rather difficult.
C1 RIKEN,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.

TI LABORATORY-FRAME VIEW OF NUCLEAR ROTATION
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL; SHELL-MODEL; EXCITATIONS
AB A novel interpretation of nuclear rotation is presented. It is shown that, in and near the ground state, the proton and neutron deformed ellipsoids are rotating in opposite directions, whereas they rotate about almost the same axis in states of higher spins. This holds, quite similarly, for angular-momentum-projected Nilsson wave functions and for wave functions in the interacting boson model. The rotational energy can then be interpreted in terms of an inertial parameter against tilting of the proton rotation axis towards the neutron axis.
C1 UNIV WASHINGTON,INST NUCL THEORY,SEATTLE,WA 98195.

TI E2 CONTRIBUTION TO THE DECAY OUT OF A SUPERDEFORMED BAND
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID DY-152; NUCLEI; STATES; HG-191; SPIN
AB The contribution of E2 transitions to the decay out of superdeformed states is evaluated on the basis of the Nilsson + particle-number conserving BCS model with angular momentum projection. It is shown that the transition matrix elements have a strong dependence on the deformation of final states, while being almost independent of the angular momentum. By considering the intermediate deformed states as final states, the E2 contribution can become sufficiently large to explain the sudden termination of the superdeformed band in the Hg region.

AF KIKUCHI, S
   YAMAZAKI, H
   OTSUKA, T
TI PERIPHERAL-RECRYSTALLIZED STRUCTURES FORMED IN AL-ZN-MG-CU-ZR ALLOY
   MATERIALS DURING EXTRUSION AND THEIR QUENCHING SENSITIVITY
SO JOURNAL OF MATERIALS PROCESSING TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
AB A study was done on the peripheral-recrystallized structures formed in Al-Zn-Mg-Cu-Zr alloy materials during extrusion and on their quenching sensitivity. It was found that the peripheral-recrystallized structures were thicker at the head and tail sections of the extrusion than at the other sections. The further downwards towards the tail, the greater the thickness of the structures became. The peripheral-recrystallized structures had a remarkable quenching sensitivity and under some heat treatment conditions, attained only half of the hardness of the fiber structure. Even with the same fiber structure, the extrusion (material) tail had a higher quenching sensitivity than that of the head portion. It is thought that the drop in strength that is encountered frequently in the proximity of the tail portion of the extrusion during actual production of this type of alloy may occur under the same mechanism as controls the above-described phenomenon, and that the phenomenon of the sharpening of sensitivity to quenching is caused by the change of Al3Zr from a precipitate coherent with the matrix to a precipitate incoherent with the matrix, resulting from the strain during extrusion. The incoherent Al3Zr precipitate is thought to become an eta-phase precipitation site. This zone of sharp quenching sensitivity responds to the surface or to the tail, which latter undergoes a large plastic strain during extrusion. In the section undergoing plastic strain, the quenching sensitivity is especially acute, and if an adequate quench rate cannot be achieved during solution treatment, such a high quenching sensitivity can be a cause of an insufficient increase in hardness after ageing.
   Most billet homogenizing treatments on this alloy are done at temperatures of about 450-degrees-C-480-degrees-C. However, it is shown that when a lower temperature of 400-degrees-C is selected as a homogenizing treatment parameter, the sharp sensitivity to quenching can be restrained.
C1 SHOWA ALUMINUM IND KK,480 INUZUKA,OYAMA,TOCHIGI,JAPAN.
CR IKEDA C, 1980, LIGHT MET, V30, P92
   KIKUCHI S, 1988, 4TH P INT AL EXTR TE, V2, P343
   SHEPPARD T, 1985, MATER SCI TECH SER, V1, P321
   SUZUKI T, 1983, LIGHT MET, V33, P399
   YOSHIDA H, 1981, LIGHT MET, V31, P20

TI RA ISOTOPES IN THE SDG INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL WITH ONE F-BOSON
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
ID COLLECTIVE NUCLEAR-STATES; SHELL-MODEL; RA-218; APPROXIMATION;
   TRANSITION; OCTUPOLE; ER-168; PROTON; LIMIT; DEEXCITATIONS
AB We study positive- and negative-parity states in Ra isotopes in terms of the proton-neutron sdg interacting-boson model with one f-boson. The present calculation correctly reproduces the spherical to deformed phase transition. Especially, we would like to stress the importance of the g-boson for reproducing the El transitions which are very strong in this region.

TI MICROSCOPIC CALCULATION OF IBM IN THE TE-BA REGION
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 21ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON RAPIDLY ROTATING NUCLEI
CY OCT 26-30, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP UNIV TOKYO, INST NUCL STUDY, INST PHYS & CHEM RES, JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST, NISHINA MEM FDN & COMMEMORAT ASSOC JAPAN WORLD EXPOSIT
HO UNIV TOKYO, HONGO CAMPUS
ID INTERACTING BOSON MODEL; SHELL-MODEL; NUCLEI; STATES
AB Recent microscopic calculations of the Proton-Neutron Interacting Boson Model are presented for Te-Xe-Ba isotopes. The IBM-2 Hamiltonian is derived from a nucleon Hamiltonian comprised of single-particle energy, pairing and quadrupole-quadrupole interactions, by carrying out mapping from multi-nucleon systems to interacting-boson systems. The microscopic origin of the O(6) dynamical symmetry or gamma-unstable deformation is discussed.

TI DOUBLE-GAMMA PHONON EXCITATION IN THE OS NUCLEI
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 21ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON RAPIDLY ROTATING NUCLEI
CY OCT 26-30, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP UNIV TOKYO, INST NUCL STUDY, INST PHYS & CHEM RES, JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST, NISHINA MEM FDN & COMMEMORAT ASSOC JAPAN WORLD EXPOSIT
HO UNIV TOKYO, HONGO CAMPUS
ID INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL
AB We investigate double-gamma phonon excitation in the Os nuclei within the framework of the proton-neutron Interacting Boson Model (IBM-2). We decompose the 1BM-2 wave-functions into multiphonon states, and see the contributions of zero, one and two phonon components in the low lying levels of the Os nuclei.

TI ESTABLISHMENT OF AN ENZYME-IMMUNOASSAY SYSTEM FOR GLIOSTATIN
   PLATELET-DERIVED ENDOTHELIAL-CELL GROWTH-FACTOR (PD-ECGF)
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE ENZYME IMMUNOASSAY; GLIOSTATIN; PLATELET-DERIVED ENDOTHELIAL CELL GROWTH
   FACTOR PD-ECGF
ID NUCLEOTIDE-SEQUENCE; MOLECULAR-CLONING; EXPRESSION; LINES; PURIFICATION;
   RECEPTOR
AB A two-site enzyme immunoassay for gliostatin (GLS)/platelet-derived endothelial cell growth factor (PD-ECGF) has been developed. The detection limit of gliostatin/PD-ECGF was 30 pg/well, and the optimal assay range was 0.1 to 10 ng/well. This assay system enabled us to confirm the immunochemical identity of both factors and to detect immunoreactive gliostatin/PD-ECGF (IR-GLS/PD-ECGF) in human biological body fluids. The age-related analysis from newborn to 69 years revealed that the serum IR-GLS/PD-ECGF level was high in infants younger than 1 year old (1.8 ng/ml) and in the 20-year-old age group (1.8 ng/ml), and highest in the umbilical cord blood (2.1 ng/ml). Curiously high concentrations were detected in saliva with a significant sex difference (11.3 ng/ml for males and 48.7 ng/ml for females), and in synovial fluids (3.7 ng/ml). A number of human tumor cells, gastric cancer cells, MKN-74, neuroblastoma cells, GOTO, as well as epidermoid carcinoma cells, A431, were found to produce a significant amount of IR-GLS/PD-ECGF (0.2 to 21.8 ng/mg protein), and some of them secreted the IR-GLS/PD-ECGF in the conditioned medium (approximately 0.5 ng/ml). The enzyme immunoassay system is sufficiently sensitive for the basic and clinical study of gliostatin/PD-ECGF in human body fluids. tissues and organs.
C1 NAGOYA CITY UNIV,SCH MED,DEPT BIOREGULAT RES,MIZUHO KU,NAGOYA,AICHI 467,JAPAN.

AU OTSUKA, T

AF OTSUKA, T
   FUKUNISHI, N
   SAGAWA, H
TI STRUCTURE OF EXOTIC NEUTRON-RICH NUCLEI
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID REACTION CROSS-SECTIONS; LIGHT-NUCLEI; MODEL; BE-11; HALO
AB A new framework, the variational shell model, is proposed to describe the structure of neutron-rich unstable nuclei. An application to Be-11 is presented. Contrary to the failure of the spherical Hartree-Fock model, the anomalous 1/2+ ground state and its neutron halo are reproduced with the Skyrme (SIII) interaction. This state is bound due to dynamical coupling between the core and the loosely bound neutron, which oscillates between the 2s1/2 and the 1d5/2 orbits.
RP OTSUKA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI SYSTEMATIC STUDY OF THE MIXED GROUND-STATE AND INTRUDER BANDS IN CD-110,
   CD-112, CD-114
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
DE PD-110(ALPHA,2N-GAMMA) E=19.8, 24.8, 28.0, 29.9 MEV; MEASURED E-GAMMA;
   I-GAMMA; SIGMA(E, E-GAMMA, THETA); GAMMA-GAMMA-COIN; Y(T);
   CD-111(N,GAMMA), EN = THERMAL; MEASURED E-GAMMA; I-GAMMA; E(CE);
   I(CE)-CD-112 DEDUCED LEVELS; J, PI, B(LAMBDA); ENRICHED TARGETS; GE
   DETECTORS; BGO-NAI(TL) ANTI-COMPTON SHIELD; MAGNETIC SPECTROMETER;
   INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL
ID INTERACTING BOSON MODEL; SHELL-MODEL; SPIN STATES; NUCLEI;
   APPROXIMATION; ISOTOPES; CD
AB The ground-state and the ''intruder'' bands in Cd-112 were investigated by means of neutron capture and Pd-106(alpha, 2n) reaction spectroscopy. Measurements of gamma-rays, angular distributions and gammagamma-coincidences were performed using Compton-suppressed Ge detectors. Our experimental results, together with published data on Cd-110 and Cd-114, were interpreted systematically in the framework of IBA-2 configuration-mixing calculations. The phenomenological model parameters are compared with microscopic predictions based on the OAI mapping procedure.

AU OTSUKA, T

TI NUCLEAR-STRUCTURE AND NUCLEAR MOMENTS STUDIED BY THE SHELL-MODEL AND THE
   INTERACTING BOSON MODEL
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference 34 / 9th International Conference on Hyperfine
   Interactions ( HFI-IX )
CY AUG 17-21, 1992
CL TOYONAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
HO OSAKA UNIV, FAC SCI, DEPT PHYS & LAB NUCL STUDIES
ID ELECTRON-SCATTERING; NEUTRON; PROTON; EXCITATIONS; DEFORMATION;
   ISOTOPES; SODIUM
AB Magnetic dipole and electric quadrupole moments are discussed in terms of the interacting boson model (IBM) and the shell model. From the viewpoint of the IBM, systematic variations of magnetic moments will be discussed by analyzing data of Xe and Ba isotopes. Magnetic and quadrupole moments of various states of Sm and Os isotopes are discussed, pointing out an open problem in the magnetic moments of Os isotopes. The importance of measuring the quadrupole moment of O(6) or gamma-unstable nuclei is emphasized by the example of Xe-128. The structure of neutron-rich unstable nuclei will be studied in terms of the shell model, by paying attention to the break-down of the closed shell structure, for instance, the collapse of N = 20 closed shell with Z << N = 20. The magnetic moment of the anomalous ground state of Be-11 is another topic of this discussion, and it is studied in terms of a new theoretical framework called variational shell model.
RP OTSUKA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

SP BUNDESMINIST FORSCHUNG & TECHNOL, DEUT FORSCHUNGSGEMEINSCH, DEUT PHYS GESELL, EUROPEAN PHYS SOC, GESELL SCHWERIONENFORSCHUNG, INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, JOHANNES GUTENBERG UNIV MAINZ, MINIST WISSENSCH & WEITERBILDUNG RHEINLAND PFALZ, BITBURGER BRAUEREI TH SIMON GMBH, C H BOEHRINGER SOHN, COHERENT GMBH, DANFYSIK A S, EG & G ORTEC, LAMBDA PHYS, SCHOTT GLASWERKE
AB A model for the structure of Li-11 is presented based on the recent measurement of momentum correlation of two neutrons which are probably originated in the loosely-bound halo neutrons. In this model, two loosely-bound neutrons move in phase in the linear momentum space, whereas are located quite far from each other around the opposite sides of the core (Li-9).

SP BUNDESMINIST FORSCHUNG & TECHNOL, DEUT FORSCHUNGSGEMEINSCH, DEUT PHYS GESELL, EUROPEAN PHYS SOC, GESELL SCHWERIONENFORSCHUNG, INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, JOHANNES GUTENBERG UNIV MAINZ, MINIST WISSENSCH & WEITERBILDUNG RHEINLAND PFALZ, BITBURGER BRAUEREI TH SIMON GMBH, C H BOEHRINGER SOHN, COHERENT GMBH, DANFYSIK A S, EG & G ORTEC, LAMBDA PHYS, SCHOTT GLASWERKE
ID HALO
AB A new method for determining the single-particle wave function of loosely bound nucleons and also for solving the many-body problem of loosely bound system is presented. This method, called Variational Shell Model, is shown to be quite successful to reproduce the anomalous ground state of Be-11 by using the Skyrme III interaction without any change. The neutron halo has been obtained theoretically for the first time without adjustment of parameters.

TI PROTON-NEUTRON DEGREE-OF-FREEDOM IN NUCLEAR SHAPE
SO NUCLEI FAR FROM STABILITY/ATOMIC MASSES AND FUNDAMENTAL CONSTANTS 1992
SE INSTITUTE OF PHYSICS CONFERENCE SERIES
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6th International Conference on Nuclei Far From Stability/9th
   International Conference on Atomic Masses and Fundamental Constants
CY JUL 19-24, 1992
CL BERNKASTEL KUES, GERMANY
SP BUNDESMINIST FORSCHUNG & TECHNOL, DEUT FORSCHUNGSGEMEINSCH, DEUT PHYS GESELL, EUROPEAN PHYS SOC, GESELL SCHWERIONENFORSCHUNG, INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, JOHANNES GUTENBERG UNIV MAINZ, MINIST WISSENSCH & WEITERBILDUNG RHEINLAND PFALZ, BITBURGER BRAUEREI TH SIMON GMBH, C H BOEHRINGER SOHN, COHERENT GMBH, DANFYSIK A S, EG & G ORTEC, LAMBDA PHYS, SCHOTT GLASWERKE
ID INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL; MIXED-SYMMETRY STATES; ELECTRON-SCATTERING;
   SHELL-MODEL; FE-56; EXCITATIONS; SEARCH
AB The proton-neutron degree of freedom in nuclear quadrupole shape is discussed in terms of the Proton-Neutron Interacting Boson Model with particular emphasis on M1 transitions and mixed-symmetry states. Mixed-symmetry 2(+) states are searched in Fe-56 and Ba-134. The realistic shell model is used for Fe-56. M1 transitions from the quasi-gamma to quasi-g bands in gamma-unstable or O(6) nuclei are discussed by taking Ba isotopes as an example. It is suggested that such M1 transitions are enhanced compared to axially symmetric nuclei as an indication of softness towards proton-neutron incoherent motion i.e., mixture of mixed-symmetry states. A new mirror-type symmetry is introduced for O(6) nuclei, and selection rules due to this symmetry is presented, making 4(2)(+)-->4(1)(+) transition allowed but 3(1)(+)-->2(1)(+) forbidden, for instance. Results of recent relevant microscopic calculations of the boson Hamiltonian are presented for Xe isotopes.
RP OTSUKA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

SP BUNDESMINIST FORSCHUNG & TECHNOL, DEUT FORSCHUNGSGEMEINSCH, DEUT PHYS GESELL, EUROPEAN PHYS SOC, GESELL SCHWERIONENFORSCHUNG, INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, JOHANNES GUTENBERG UNIV MAINZ, MINIST WISSENSCH & WEITERBILDUNG RHEINLAND PFALZ, BITBURGER BRAUEREI TH SIMON GMBH, C H BOEHRINGER SOHN, COHERENT GMBH, DANFYSIK A S, EG & G ORTEC, LAMBDA PHYS, SCHOTT GLASWERKE
AB Fast dipole transitions can be signatures of special collective excitation modes such as double octupoles (E1) or mixed-symmetry states (M1). Results of the searches for octupole related two-phonon states in Sm-144 with N=82 and for mixed-symmetry 2(+) states in the 0(6) nucleus Ba-134 are presented.

AU FUKUNISHI, N

AF FUKUNISHI, N
   OTSUKA, T
   SEBE, T
TI VANISHING OF THE SHELL GAP IN N = 20 NEUTRON-RICH NUCLEI
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID ENERGY-LEVELS; 2+ STATE; ISOTOPES; MODEL; SODIUM
AB Large-scale state-of-the-art shell model calculations with 2s1d and lower 2p1f shells are shown to present a unified description of N = 20 isotones with Z = 10-20, covering both stable and unstable nuclei. The calculations demonstrate that, although the N = 20 closed-shell structure remains for Z greater-than-or-equal-to 14, the N=20 shell gap vanishes naturally towards nuclei with Z greater-than-or-equal-to 12, giving rise to various anomalous features including those in 32Mg and 22Na.
C1 HOSEI UNIV,COLL ENGN,TOKYO 184,JAPAN.
RP FUKUNISHI, N (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI THE CRYSTAL WATER AFFECTING THE 2EG-]4A2G RELAXATION IN
   TRIS(OXALATO)CHROMATE(III) COMPLEXES
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID EXCITED-STATE RELAXATION; CHROMIUM(III) COMPLEXES; DECAY; PHOTOPHYSICS;
   SPECTROSCOPY; LUMINESCENCE; SPECTRA
AB The measurements of absorption and luminescence spectra and luminescence decay are carried out on pure crystals of Na3[Cr(OX)3] . xH2O (ox2-=C2O42-) (x=5 or 4) and Li3[Cr(OX)3] . yH2O (y=6 or 5). In sodium salt, dehydration of one crystal water (x=4) causes the luminescence intensity to be about thirty times larger and the lifetime to be about thirty times longer than those of the most hydrated crystal (x=5) while the opposite trend is obtained in lithium salt. However, in both salts, no change of the position of luminescence maximum is observed by the dehydration of one crystal water from the most hydrated crystals. Comparing these results with X-ray crystallographic analyses shows that a crystal water located near the oxalato-oxygen atom, which is coordinated to Cr3+ ion, affects the 2E(g)-->4A2g (all in Oh notation) relaxation of [Cr(ox)3]3- complexes in the pure crystal.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT CHEM,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 152,JAPAN.
CR ADAMSON AW, 1983, J CHEM EDUC, V60, P797

TI AC RESISTIVITY AND POWER LOSS OF MN-ZN FERRITES
SO IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 13TH INTERNATIONAL TELECOMMUNICATIONS ENERGY CONF
CY NOV, 1991
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP INST ELECTR INFORMAT & COMMUN ENGINEERS
DE MN-ZN FERRITE; AC RESISTIVITY; DIELECTRIC LOSS; POWER LOSS
AB Ac resistivity and power loss values for Mn-Zn ferrite material have been investigated by electrical and magnetic measurements.  The ac resistivity shows an inductive dependency on frequency for the low dc resistive samples or for highly dc resistive ones at high temperature, while a capacitive dependency on frequency was observed for the highly resistive materials at the room temperature. These phenomena were interpreted by the dependence of ac resistivity on the dc resistivity, complex permeability and complex permittivity. The dependency of the power losses on the dc resistivity, temperature and frequence were also examined with analysis of power loss term. Dividing the power loss into hysteresis loss and eddy current loss, the frequency dependence of the eddy current loss was found to vary with the magnitude of the dc resistivity as follows: The eddy current loss of low dc resistive materials depends on the dc resistivity. On the other hand, the eddy current loss for high resistive materials is determined by the ac resistivity, contributed from dielectric loss.
RP YAMADA, S (reprint author), TOKIN CORP,SENDAI RES LABS,SENDAI 982,JAPAN.

TI E0 DECAYS OF BETA-VIBRATIONS IN THE O(6) LIMIT OF THE NEUTRON-PROTON
   INTERACTING BOSON MODEL
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW C
LA English
DT Article
ID STATES; NUCLEI
AB Expressions are derived for the E0 transition strengths for the symmetric and antisymmetric beta-vibrational bandhead states to the ground state for O(6)-like nuclei. These E0 transitions are the only ones allowed to the ground state, and we predict them to be of similar magnitude. The isomer shifts for these beta-vibrational states are also discussed, as well as the isotope shifts for the ground states. We propose the Ba isotopes around A almost-equal-to 132 as possible candidates for observing these E0 decays.
C1 UNIV ARIZONA,DEPT PHYS,TUCSON,AZ 85721.
   UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RP BARRETT, BR (reprint author), MAX PLANCK INST NUCL PHYS,W-6900 HEIDELBERG 1,GERMANY.

TI CHAOS-TO-ORDER TRANSITION IN SPHERICAL HEAVY-NUCLEI
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID FLUCTUATION PROPERTIES; ENERGY-LEVELS; SPECTRA; PHYSICS
AB Contrary to the conventional view of spherical nuclei as being chaotic in nature, we find, by means of level statistics, that some heavy nuclei exhibit deviations toward regularity unlike the predictions of the random-matrix theory. We show that the degree of regularity is closely connected to the ratio of the nuclear size to the range of the nuclear force.

TI LEVEL SCHEME AND MIXED-SYMMETRY STATES OF BA-134 FROM IN-BEAM (N,
   N'GAMMA) MEASUREMENTS
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
DE BA-134(N,N'GAMMA); E = 2-3 MEV; MEASURED E(GAMMA, I(GAMMA,
   I(GAMMA)(THETA); DOPPLER SHIFT; SIGMA(E-GAMMA,E); BA-134 DEDUCED LEVELS;
   J PI BRANCHING RATIOS; DELTA,+(1/2); B(LAMBDA); M1 TRANSITIONS; ENRICHED
   TARGET; HYPERPURE GE DETECTORS; PROTON-NEUTRON INTERACTING BOSON MODEL
   CALCULATIONS; O(6) NUCLEI; MIXED-SYMMETRY STATES
ID COLLECTIVE NUCLEAR-STATES; INTERACTING BOSON MODEL; SHELL-MODEL;
   VIBRATIONAL-STATES; INELASTIC NEUTRON; PROTON; EXCITATIONS; TRANSITIONS;
   SCATTERING; DECAY
AB The decay properties of the excited states of Ba-134 below 3 MeV have been studied with the (n, n' gamma) reaction. From gamma-ray excitation function and angular distribution measurements, several new levels, spin-parity values and multipole mixing ratios were obtained. Lifetimes were measured by the Doppler-shift attenuation method, and reduced transition probabilities were calculated for a number of levels using the proton-neutron interacting boson model. The 2029 and 2088 keV states appear to share the properties of the lowest mixed-symmetry 2+ state.
C1 UNIV KENTUCKY,LEXINGTON,KY 40506.
   UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI A PAIRING EFFECT IN GAMMA-SOFT NUCLEI
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTING BOSONS; EVEN NUCLEI; SHELL-MODEL; INERTIA; MOMENT; STATES;
   BANDS
AB A new regularity in the level structure of gamma-soft nuclei is suggested by using the O(6) limit of the interacting boson model. This regularity, which will bc referred to as tau-compression, is thc compression of level spacing between neighboring O(5) multiplets for higher tau-values. It is shown that the pairing interaction is the origin of the tau-compression. The spectra of Xe-126-130 are discussed as prominent examples of the tau-compression.

TI GINOCCHIO MODEL WITH ISOSPIN
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID DYNAMICAL SYMMETRY MODEL; INTERACTING BOSON MODEL; NUCLEAR SHELL-MODEL;
   FERMION; STATES; LIMIT
AB We study the sp(8) subgroup of the isospin-invariant Ginocchio model. The allowed quantum numbers are determined in terms of Young's diagrams. Using this result, we discuss the excitation energy of a model hamiltonian.

AB 2-Deoxy-2-[(2S,3R)-(2-fluoro-3-hydroxytetradecanoyl)amino]-3-O-[(3R)-3-tetradecanoyloxytetradecanoyl]-D-glucopyranose 4-(dihydrogen phosphate) and 2-deoxy-2-[(2R,3S)-(2-fluoro-3-hydroxytetradecanoyl)amino]-3-O-[(3R)-3-tetradecanoyloxytetradecanoyl]-D-glucopyranose 4-(dihydrogen phosphate) were synthesized. TI MAGNETIC DIPOLE TRANSITIONS AND PROTON-NEUTRON DEGREES OF FREEDOM IN
   NUCLEAR-DEFORMATION
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2ND INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ON-LINE NUCLEAR ORIENTATION ( OLNO-2 )
CY OCT 16-19, 1991
CL OAK RIDGE, TN
SP JOINT INST HEAVY ION & RES, UNIV ISOTOPE SEPARATOR OAK RIDGE
HO JOINT INST HEAVY ION RES
ID INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL; MIXED-SYMMETRY STATES; ELECTRON-SCATTERING;
   SHELL-MODEL; FE-56; EXCITATIONS; SEARCH
AB The M1 transitions between low-lying collective states are discussed from the viewpoint of the Proton-Neutron Interacting Boson Model, with particular emphasis on the mixed-symmetry states. Mixed-symmetry 2+ states are studied for Fe-56 and Cr-54 in terms of realistic and large-scale shell-model calculations, including MI properties. The Doorway-state character of the mixed-symmetry 2+ state is proposed with examples in these nuclei. The possible candidate of the mixed-symmetry 2+ state in Ba-134 is analyzed based on recent experiment by Molnar et al. on M1 transitions. The M1 transitions from the quasi-gamma to quasi-g bands in gamma-unstable or 0(6) nuclei are discussed next, by taking Ba isotopes as an example. It is suggested that such M1 transitions are enhanced compared to axially symmetric nuclei as an indication of softness towards proton-neutron incoherent motion in gamma-unstable nuclei, i.e., mixture of mixed-symmetry states. A new mirror-type symmetry is introduced for gamma-unstable nuclei, and the Ml selection rule due to this symmetry is presented, making 4(2)+ --> 4(1)+ transition allowed but 3(1)+ --> 2(1)+ forbidden, for instance.
RP OTSUKA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI ISOTOPE SHIFT AND INTERACTING BOSON MODEL
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON LASERS IN NUCLEAR PHYSICS
CY SEP 09-10, 1991
CL SAITAMA, JAPAN
SP INST PHYS & CHEM RES, OSAKA UNIV, RES CTR NUCL PHYS, INOUE FDN SCI
HO NISHINA HALL, RIKEN
ID CHARGE RADII; SHELL-MODEL; PROTON; TRANSITION
AB The Interacting Boson Model (IBM) description for the isotope shift is reviewed. A schematic explanation of the basic properties is given first.  The calculations for Xe-Ba-Ce and Sm isotopes are reported. For the former, the IBM-2 calculation is repeated and the isotope shift is analyzed with new parameters. For Sm isotopes, the sdg IBM-2 is used for the first time. Both calculations present good agreement to experiment, with a rather global value of the parameter for the deformed isotope shift. In addition, two other topics are discussed: one is a microscopic calculation of the spherical isotope shift, and the other is a striking correlation between the deformed isotope shift and the M1 excitation strength to the scissors mode.
RP OTSUKA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

   HONMA, M
TI INTERACTING BOSON MODEL FOR SUPERDEFORMATION
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID COLLECTIVE NUCLEAR STATES; SHELL-MODEL; DY-152; BAND; NILSSON; DECAY
AB The superdeformation is discussed from the point of view of the interacting boson model (IBM).  By studying the structure of the superdeformed band in terms of the Nilsson model, it is suggested that superdeformed states have a spherical inert core which is much smaller than that for normal states.  Based on the dominant role of the J-pi = 0+ and 2+ nucleon pairs in the Nilsson wave function, the super interacting boson model is proposed.  Due to the small inert core, the number of bosons in the super IBM is increased by a factor of 2-3 from the normal IBM.  The SU(3) symmetry is shown to be suitable, indicating a possibility of super beta and gamma-bands around 2.4 MeV for 194Hg.  The boson charge and the interaction strength of the super IBM turn out to be comparable to those in the normal IBM.  The decay out of the superdeformed band is reproduced in agreement with experiment for 194Hg.
RP OTSUKA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI MIXED-SYMMETRY 2+ STATE OF FE-56 IN REALISTIC SHELL-MODEL
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTING-BOSON MODEL; ELECTRON-SCATTERING; NUCLEI
AB The mixed-symmetry 2+ state of Fe-56 is investigated by a large-scale shell-model calculation. We can reproduce the experimental energy levels by the Kuo-Brown interaction, as well as the E 2 and M 1 transition probabilities. The (e,e') form factors are also reproduced by including the core-polarization effect. By inspecting the shell-model wave functions thus tested, it is found that the 2(2)+ and 2(4)+ states share a large fraction of the mixed-symmetry component.

TI MICROSTRUCTURE AND PHYSICAL-PROPERTIES OF MN-ZN FERRITES FOR
   HIGH-FREQUENCY POWER-SUPPLIES
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
AB The power loss of Mn-Zn ferrites and its dependency on the microstructural factors have been investigated.  The power loss was found to be lowered due to the formation of a high-electrical-resistive boundary layers, which is accomplished by an addition of specific refractory oxides, which are concentrated on the grain boundary and form a boundary layer with CaO.  The new material, having a low power loss at high frequency (approximately 1 MHz), has been developed with the HfO2 addition.
RP OTSUKI, E (reprint author), TOKIN CORP,SENDAI RES LABS,SENDAI,JAPAN.

TI SPIN DEPENDENCE OF THE MOMENT OF INERTIA AND THE IBM
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID COLLECTIVE NUCLEAR-STATES; INTERACTING BOSON MODEL; SHELL-MODEL; LIMIT
AB The increase of the moment of inertia observed at high-spin states in deformed nuclei is incorporated into the hamiltonian of the interacting boson model-1 (IBM1) by introducing a new spin-dependent term.  The new hamiltonian suppresses the level spacing at high spins and improves remarkably the description of the level schemes of Er-162, Er-164.  A microscopic origin of this new term is discussed in connection with the pairing correlation by using the OAI method.

PT J
AU OTSUKA, T
   HIGUCHI, K
   SEYA, K
AF OTSUKA, T
   HIGUCHI, K
   SEYA, K
TI ULTRASONIC LEVITATION BY STEPPED CIRCULAR VIBRATING PLATE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS BRIEF
   COMMUNICATIONS & REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
AB A high intensity ultrasound field was produced by a new type sound source called a stepped circular vibrating plate, and the experimental results on levitation in air by ultrasound energy are described. The density of samples, frequencies and sample dimensions were varied.
   The minimum threshold of sound pressure required for levitating the samples was found proportional to sample density, and was also inversely proportional to the ultrasonic frequency used.
RP OTSUKA, T (reprint author), NIHON UNIV, COLL IND TECHNOL, NARASHINO, CHIBA 275, JAPAN.
CR GALLEGOJUAREZ JA, 1974, J SOUND VIBRATION, V26, P411
   MITOME H, 1989, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V28, P146
   OTSUKA T, 1986, 12TH ICA L, V2

   OTSUKA T, 1982, IEICE US8172 TECH RE
